intro: Schwalbea, commonly known as the "false hellebore," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Polygonaceae. It consists of a single species, Schwalbea americana, which is native to the southeastern United States. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and wetlands. Schwalbea is often found in swampy areas and is adapted to tolerate waterlogged soils.
